definition: (accounting) to balance the books/to do the accounts/(fig.) to settle an account/to get one's revenge
to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute
account/bill/debt/CL:本[ben3],筆|笔[bi3]
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)

sentences.english: Even if Chu sword the finishing don't think Zhang behind the autumn, tin this opportunity slipped away for the pearly white.
sentences.chinese: 即使楚剑功不秋后算账，可这机会就白白溜走了。

sentences.english: If you haudio-videoe finished dinner I'll ask over the waiter for the payments.
sentences.chinese: 借使你吃完了，我就叫办事生来算账。

sentences.english: Therefore, the kingdom of heaven is like a king who wanted to settle accounts with his servants.
sentences.chinese: 天国好像一个王，要和他仆人算账。

sentences.english: This will cause Jack to come after them.
sentences.chinese: 这将会导致杰克来找他算账。

sentences.english: After a long time the lord of those servants cometh, and reckoneth with them.
sentences.chinese: 过了许久，那些仆人的主人来了，和他们算账。

sentences.english: I'm going to bust in on that damned harbor master.
sentences.chinese: 我要去找那该死的港务长算账。

sentences.english: After a long time the master of those servants returned and settled accounts with them.
sentences.chinese: 过了许久，那些仆人的主人来了，和他们算账。

definition: undisclosed account/to settle matters later/to blame sb after the event
account/bill/debt/CL:本[ben3],筆|笔[bi3]
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to ask for sth back/to recover
to renege on a debt
to look for trouble
to be made a scapegoat/to be unjustly blamed
to own up to a fault/to admit the truth/to acknowledge a debt
to give change
to pick fault with/to spot the differences/to nitpick/to pick a quarrel/to find complaint with
to fall out with sb and become hostile
to confront (in court etc)/confrontation
lit. old account/old debt/fig. old scores to settle/old quarrels/old grudge
bastard (insult)/son of a bitch
let it be/let it pass/forget about it
